content.text:
[@dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519)

> my main reaction to this is that now the dependencies are not strictly statically analyzable  
> ...  
> What is the use-case that warrants dependencies inside the file? 

True, that's definitely a big step backward. I was thinking that [espree](https://github.com/eslint/espree) would be useful for making sure you're *only* installing when a string literal is passed, but that's probably too much of a footgun. My use-case is that I have a ton of tiny experiments where even *naming the file* seems like overkill but that I'd like the dependency versions to be saved anyway. Plus it was a good way to experiment with the `debug` package, I've been looking for an excuse to play around with it a bit more.
